4:
--------------------
Text: Sanheyuan:  Typically there are three structural divisions within the horizontal building in the U, which is called a "three-jian" building (Chinese: 三間屋; pinyin: "sānjiānwū").
Triplets:<Sanheyuan
5:
--------------------
Text: Sanheyuan:  The purpose of this main building varies by region, but typically consists of a central room serving ceremonial needs flanked on either side by a bedroom.
Triplets:<Sanheyuan
6:
--------------------
Text: Sanheyuan:  The two wings making up the arms of the U may be long or short, according to need, and provide room for kitchens, toilets, storage, and additional bedrooms.
Triplets:<Sanheyuan
7:
--------------------
<Text: Sanheyuan:  In Taiwan, the wings of the sanheyuan are called "protecting dragons" (Chinese: 護龍; pinyin: "hùlóng").>
<Triplets:<Sanheyuan
9:
--------------------
Text: Sanheyuan:  The inner pair of "hulong" were traditionally called "inner protectors" (Chinese: 內護; pinyin: "nèihù"), the second pair "outer protectors" (Chinese: 外護; pinyin: "wàihù"), and so on.
Triplets:< Sanheyuan
